briefdescription.para: Read the value of a Control and Status Register.

parameterdescription.para: The name of an uint32_t variable where the read value will be saved

The 12-bit address of the CSR to be read. rvsteel_csr.h provides named macros with the addresses of all CSRs implemented in RISC-V Steel. The macro names are in the form CSR_<csr_name>. Example: CSR_MSTATUS.

briefdescription.para: Write a value to a Control and Status Register.

parameterdescription.para: The value to be written to the CSR

The 12-bit address of the CSR to be written. rvsteel_csr.h provides named macros with the addresses of all CSRs implemented in RISC-V Steel. The macro names are in the form CSR_<csr_name>. Example: CSR_MSTATUS.

briefdescription.para: Atomic read/write a value to a Control and Status Register.

parameterdescription.para: The name of an uint32_t variable where the read value will be saved
The value to be written to the CSR

The 12-bit address of the CSR to be read/written. rvsteel_csr.h provides named macros with the addresses of all CSRs implemented in RISC-V Steel. The macro names are in the form CSR_<csr_name>. Example: CSR_MSTATUS.

briefdescription.para: Set specific bits in a Control and Status Register based on the bit mask provided.

parameterdescription.para: A 32-bit mask indicating which bits must be set to 1.

The 12-bit address of the CSR to be affected. rvsteel_csr.h provides named macros with the addresses of all CSRs implemented in RISC-V Steel. The macro names are in the form CSR_<csr_name>. Example: CSR_MSTATUS.

briefdescription.para: Clear specific bits in a Control and Status Register based on the bit mask provided.

parameterdescription.para: A 32-bit mask indicating which bits must be cleared to 0.

The 12-bit address of the CSR to be affected. rvsteel_csr.h provides named macros with the addresses of all CSRs implemented in RISC-V Steel. The macro names are in the form CSR_<csr_name>. Example: CSR_MSTATUS.

briefdescription.para: Atomic read/set bits in a Control and Status Register. The bits are set based on the bit mask provided.

parameterdescription.para: The name of an uint32_t variable where the read value will be saved
A 32-bit mask indicating which bits must be set to 1.

The 12-bit address of the CSR to be read/written. rvsteel_csr.h provides named macros with the addresses of all CSRs implemented in RISC-V Steel. The macro names are in the form CSR_<csr_name>. Example: CSR_MSTATUS.

briefdescription.para: Atomic read/clear bits in a Control and Status Register. The bits are cleared based on the bit mask provided.

parameterdescription.para: The name of an uint32_t variable where the read value will be saved
A 32-bit mask indicating which bits must be cleared to 0.

The 12-bit address of the CSR to be read/written. rvsteel_csr.h provides named macros with the addresses of all CSRs implemented in RISC-V Steel. The macro names are in the form CSR_<csr_name>. Example: CSR_MSTATUS.

briefdescription.para: Globally enable interrupt requests by setting the global Machine Interrupt Enable (MIE) bit in the Machine Status (MSTATUS) CSR. Note that an interrupt only causes a trap if it is also enabled in the Machine Interrupt Enable (CSR).

detaileddescription.para: Function csr_enable_irq(uint32_t mask) can be used to enable specific interrupt types. For example, to enable Machine External Interrupts, do:
To enable all interrupts, regardless of its type, do: csr_global_enable_irq(); CSR_SET(CSR_MIE,MIP_MIE_MASK_ALL);

briefdescription.para: Globally disable all interrupt requests by clearing the global Machine Interrupt Enable (MIE) bit in the Machine Status (MSTATUS) CSR.
Enable vectored mode for interrupt requests.
Enable direct mode for interrupt requests.
